page.title: 16Coniston Hall Farm
page.content: A larger than average farm, owned by the{National Trust.}The total area is 145 hectares. {LIVESTOCK:}55 Hereford/Fresian suckler cows and 55 calves, 1000 Herdwick and Swaledale sheep, 1 Charolais bull. In spring,{lambing}starts arond the 10th April until the beginning of May. In July the sheep are{clipped}for their wool, and later{dipped}to prevent sheep scab.{Hay and silage}are cut when the weather allows; recently the purchase of a round baler for big bale hay and silage making has made the task much easier. During winter the cattle are housed, and the sheep are fed outside, particularly in{hard {weather.}The farm has an additional enterprise of a 6 hectare{campsite. This is very important to the management of the farm, in terms of the income it generates.
